titlepage.titleproper: Guide to the Wilkins Media Company Records, 1967-1998 and undated

The John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History

did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.unittitle: Wilkins Media Company records 1967-1998 and undated
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: Wilkins Media Company is an outdoor advertising company based in Atlanta, Georgia. Founded in 1965 as Southern Outdoor Markets, the company changed its name in 1974 to Associates of the Bell Company. In 1987 Bill Wilkins purchased the company, changing the name to Wilkins Outdoor Network. The name changed again in 1999 to Wilkins Media Company.

The Wilkins Media Company Records span the years 1967-1998 and include slides, photographs, presentation scripts, audio and video cassettes, brochures, pamphlets and publications related to Wilkins Media Company's activities as well as to the outdoor advertising industry in general. Represented are materials from the Institute of Outdoor Advertising, Outdoor Advertising Association of America, Patrick Media Group, Traffic Audit Bureau, Metromedia Technologies and Naegele Advertising Companies. Companies represented include Dole, Ford, Pacific Gas and Electric (PG&E) and Toyota. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
In addition, original audiovisual materials are closed to patron use. Research Services staff need to produce use copies before contents can be accessed.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Wilkins Media Company Records, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Wilkins Media Company Records were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift from 2002-2005.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Encoded by Neale Stokes and Richard Collier, June 2011
Accessions 2002-0062, 2005-0054, and 2003-0223 were merged into one collection, described in this finding aid.
Descriptive sources and standards used to create this inventory: DACS, EAD, NCEAD guidelines, and local Style Guide.
This finding aid is NCEAD compliant.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Founded in 1965 as Southern Outdoor Markets, the company changed its name in 1974 to Associates of the Bell Company. In 1987 Bill Wilkins purchased the company, changing the name to Wilkins Outdoor Network. The name changed again in 1999 to Wilkins Media Company.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The Wilkins Media Company Records span the years 1967-1998 and include slides, photographs, presentation scripts, audio and video cassettes, brochures, pamphlets and publications related to the company's activities as well as to the outdoor advertising industry in general. Represented are materials from the Institute of Outdoor Advertising, Outdoor Advertising Association of America, Patrick Media Group, Traffic Audit Bureau, Metromedia Technologies and Naegele Advertising Companies. Companies represented include Dole, Ford, Pacific Gas and Electric (PG&E) and Toyota.

arrangement.head: Collection Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Collection is arranged into five series: Slides; Photographs; Printed Material; Audiovisual Materials; and Oversized Materials. Slides is comprised of color slides of billboards and other outdoor advertising in a variety of locations, predominantly in the United States. Photographs contain color print photographs of billboards and other outdoor advertizing. Printed Material contains brochures, pamplets, posters, industry publications, price guides, presentation scripts, and other printed material from a variety of sources. Audiovisual Materials contains video cassettes and one audio cassette, from a variety of producers. Most items are related to advertising and outdoor advertising. Oversized Materials contains large format materials removed from previous series.

controlaccess.head: Subject Headings
controlaccess.p: These are searchable subject entries for this collection. Performing a search on these subjects in the Duke University Libraries online catalog will bring up other related research materials.

scopecontent.p: Contains color slides of billboards and other outdoor advertising in a variety of locations, predominantly in the United States. Slides are arranged as received. Some have been removed from original containers; folder titles reflect original labeling.

scopecontent.p: Includes brochures, pamphlets, posters, industry publications, price guides, presentation scripts, and other printed material from a variety of sources. Publishers include the Institute of Outdoor Advertising, Metromedia Technologies, the Outdoor Advertising Association of America, Outdoor Network USA, Patrick Media Group and Traffic Audit Bureau. Grouped by publisher and organized alphabetically by title.
